comment: Professor does not show up to scheduled meetings when in need of her help to understand her requirements. A 1000 introductory leveled course given to students as if it is an advanced 4000 leveled course. Professor favored students and showed signs of implicit bias. An educated professor but what's education without compassion for students. Beware.

I took this professor a year ago & have come to check if her ratings have went up. They are indeed still low, showing that this is a professor to avoid. I still have PTSD from taking this course with her. Her response to every negative post show that she lacks accountability and has no intention to make the courses better for her students.
Not the best experience, lacks useful information to students.
Very hard grader. Not really helpful

First I would like to say that you can follow the instructions and everything and still get a failing grade. It was several other students who felt the same way so I know it is not just me. The professor should change a lot of things from how the course is graded very poorly. It is just my opinion because It will stress you out if you let it.

DO NOT  take this class with this professor she is awful at responding to email in a professional way she grades you on everything (participation) and she grades terribly. you could have done everything right and followed the rubric to a perfection but she will still find a way to deduct points.

I implore do not take this class with this professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Took the same class with another professor and got an A-. Take this course with any other professor. Graded essay's ridiculously hard.
The class was not too bad, but she was very unlikeable. She was always annoyed whenever someone asked her a question, and she had a nasty attitude most of the time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: very informal. taking her right now and she is unprofessional, curses in class and goes on irrelevant tangents, then gets upset when we don't come to class. overall, just a very insufferable person.

Honest to God the worst professor I have come across during my education. Doesn't care if you fail or die literally. you'd be better off taking ANYONE else you can find. Unreasonable, unprofessional & unnecessary.

All actual material is learned outside of class and lecture is spent on peer teaching. The she is borderline snarky and can easily rub you the wrong way. She is very... literal about participation which with some creative thinking could be counted as discussion boards, polls, or maybe just showing up like how every other professor counts it.

The syllabus was straightforward, and she was as well. Weekly readings from the book and many short chapter quizzes. Midterm + final exam. Weekly group discussions and presentations. She knows her stuff and answered any questions the class had. Answered emails. Overall I left the class feeling more confident, so I'd recommend her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Scheinfeld is very friendly. However, I do not like the way the course is taught through textbook work. Too many words on a page really bother me, so grasping material through that is tough. Additionally, I am not a fan of how class participation is graded, as I have a tough time being around others and speaking out loud is difficult for me.

This professor was not the easiest to deal with. Attendance is not "mandatory," but you'll fail in participation if you don't attend anyway, even though attending doesn't help with course material. Unclear, non-specific, and conflicting criterion with strict grading. Not a good personality either. Victim mindset lowkey
Rating? Awful. Difficult? Yes, very difficult to deal with.
Choose a different professor! That's all I can say.

Coursework was fine, she's a really tough grader though. Uses an interactive layout and format, especially in Discussion Boards. The final project is an essay that has poor instructions since there are multiple options on how to complete it. Quiz questions were kinda hard, mostly true or false questions. Take her if u want stress & no free time.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Online Savvy

comment: WORST TEACHER EVER. TAKES FOREVER TO GRADE AND GRADES HARSH. SAVE YOURSELF TIME JUST TAKE ANOTHER CLASS. IDEK HOW SHE BECAME A TEACHER TBH
N/A
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: She passes the vibe check to where she gets that most people are just there because they have to be so she's not super strict or anything but she's passionate enough about the subject to where you'll probably have at least some investment in what she's teaching. She also got my class cookies on the last day so that was cool.
Dr. Scheinfeld was ok. The course was not too hard but was far from interesting. If you want to do well go to class and ask questions to get participation points.

My class voted on only doing weekly participation and the final project. I liked having say in that, and having less work each week, but then most of my grade was the one project. She provides a lot of feedback, was willing to meet one on one to go over questions. And offered so much extra credit just for attending writing workshops on campus.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Scheinfeld was probably one of my favorite teachers this semester! She is easy to get in contact with and makes sure her students are getting all the help. She is a VERY tough grader though so you can't slack off. Based off of quizzes/discussion boards. She checks in every week and allow students to meet with her 101. 11/10 recommend!!!

Dr. Scheinfeld is the most amazing professor at KSU! 10/10 recommend! Don't listen to the haters! They are just mad that they didn't pass the class! As long as you are proactive and do the work on time, you will succeed. She is always willing to help either online or in person. She is very organized and open to feedback to improve the class.

Solid professor. Comes off as a jerk in the syllabus, but is pretty casual in person. Relaxed lectures with an emphasis on discussion of the topics versus being solely taught. Group presentations are important in this class. Quizzes aren't so hard but exams are long. The professor also tries to make assignments as easy as possible. Easy class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Overall a pretty fun professor and the lectures in class were engaging. She's quite knowledgeable in this field and will elaborate on your questions and interests! We had quizzes and a final essay. She gives you the opportunity to set up a meeting for the final paper and will help guide you in the right direction! I'd take her again!

There was weekly quizzes (all timed 8 min) which isn't enough time so you are most likely rushing. Not many course work so good if you have challenging classes. A final paper that is graded very harshly. Not many grades, but extra credit is offered. It was an ok class.

Dr. Emily was awesome! She make our class enjoyable. Only like 10 quizzes and she drops the two lowest quiz grades. Quizzes can have some trick questions but she'll give you credit if you can prove your answer was right. The final paper had great topics to choose from and she gave out extra credit for it! Take her she's worth it, fun and cares.

Her grading was unclear sometimes, she was funny and her class was enjoyable, but the grading was hard sometimes. She is really helpful and will work with you if you need help on your assignments, but she was still difficult, with the guidelines for some assignments not being clear. I would take her again if I needed to, but thats not preferred.

I took her for Honors COMM 1000. Grades based the textbook work, your group project, and your HON project. Class is discussion-based w someone presenting their project every period. Cares about your thoughts during the discussions. 

BEWARE: paying attention is a grade. Don't text in class, she takes notes and you won't know until it's December.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: RUN! 50-100 pages of readying a week, blog posts, papers, group work, quizzes, etc. with no clear rubric. No grading scale 10/10 its above proficient/ proficient/ or below. PowerPoint slides blank so you have to come to class, hates being questioned will literally cuss you out and unfair grader. A genuinely nice person, just not a good professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I have never rated a professor on here before but felt the need to. She was the worst professor I have ever had in my college experience so far. Respond to emails in a timely fashion but grades hard and would say unfairly. Doesnt require attendance but still makes it part of your grade. Her lectures were not relevant to the material.
You will work hard but you will become a better writer.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Gives good feedback

comment: She was a very nice person, but a terrible professor. You will have tons of assignments each week, and theres a podcast group project, which absolutely sucks. Shes a hard grader and tries to listen to feedback, but this does not help with the hoops youll have to jump through to complete this course. Do NOT take her if you can help it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: If there was a Forbes 400 list for the worlds greatest professors, Dr. Scheinfeld would be at the top! Its a lot of work, but thats what comes with an upper-division course. She created a group chat to immediately answer all questions and even throw in a few memes. She gives great feedback and lectures. Take her and never look back !!!!!!!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring
